title: Sokoban Level 1e
data:
This is one of the new possible maps for [Sokoban](/wiki/Sokoban "Sokoban") Level 1 in [UnNetHack](/wiki/UnNetHack "UnNetHack") and [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"). It has 12 [boulders](/wiki/Boulder "Boulder") and 11 [pits](/wiki/Pit "Pit"), leaving 1 spare boulder.

Like all Sokoban levels in UnNetHack, this level may be flipped horizontally or vertically.

```
----             0 boulder
|??|             ^ pit
|..------------- > starting position/downstairs
|..^^^^^^^^^^^.| < upstairs
|-0--######---+|Â ? scroll of earth
|.0.0......#...| # iron bars
|...|......#...|
---.|.00.0.#...|
  |.|...|0.#...|
  |.|.00...#...|
  |.|.|.00.#.<.|
  |.|..0.-------
  |.---..|
  |....|>|
  ----...|
     -----
```

## Strategy

The following solution may not be very fast or organized. Improvements welcome. Like all Sokoban levels it can be solved without making any boulders 'stick'.

All boulders are replaced by letters so they can be referred to. Moving the boulders is shortened to **r** for right, **l** for left, **u** for up, **d** for down. An asterisk is used to denote the last move filled a pit (and thus removed the boulder from the game). So "**N** ddrr\*" means move boulder **N** two times down and two times to the right into a pit.

First, push a couple of boulders out of the way and solve the first boulder, grabbing the [scrolls of earth](/wiki/Scroll_of_earth "Scroll of earth") in the process:

```
----             C rrrr
|??|             B rrrr
|..------------- A uudr*
|..^^^^^^^^^^^.|
|-A--######---+|
|.B.C......#...|
|...|......#...|
---.|.DE.F.#...|
  |.|...|G.#...|
  |.|.HI...#...|
  |.|.|.JK.#.<.|
  |.|..L.-------
  |.---..|
  |....|@|
  ----...|
     -----
```

Now solve the next six boulders:

```
----             B llll uuud rr*
|..|             C llll lluu udrr r*
|..------------- D uull lluu udrr rr*
|.@.^^^^^^^^^^.| E uull lllu uudr rrrr*
|-.--######---+| F llll uull luuu drrr rrr*
|.....B.C..#...| G uuul llll lluu udrr rrrr r*
|...|......#...|
---.|.DE.F.#...|
  |.|...|G.#...|
  |.|.HI...#...|
  |.|.|.JK.#.<.|
  |.|..L.-------
  |.---..|
  |....|>|
  ----...|
     -----
```

The next boulder needs to be moved specifically to prevent getting the final boulders stuck, but from there the solution is straightforward:

```
----             J u
|..|             I uuuu llll luuu drrr rrrr r*
|..------------- L uuuu uull lllu uudr rrrr rrrr*
|.......@.^^^^.| J luuu ulll lluu udrr rrrr rrrr*
|-.--######---+| K lluu uuul llll uuud rrrr rrrr rrr*
|..........#...|
|...|......#...|
---.|......#...|
  |.|...|..#...|
  |.|.HI...#...|
  |.|.|.JK.#.<.|
  |.|..L.-------
  |.---..|
  |....|>|
  ----...|
     -----
```

The level is now complete. Remember to check under the final boulder in case an item happens to be underneath.

```
----
|..|
|..-------------
|...........@..|
|-.--######---+|
|..........#...|
|...|......#...|
---.|......#...|
  |.|...|..#...|
  |.|.H....#...|
  |.|.|....#.<.|
  |.|....-------
  |.---..|
  |....|>|
  ----...|
     -----
```

## Next level

UnNetHack's Sokoban branch has only three levels per game, collapsing the 'second' levels into the first floor, so the first level leads straight to the pool of third levels:

- [Sokoban Level 3a](/wiki/Sokoban_Level_3a "Sokoban Level 3a")
- [Sokoban Level 3b](/wiki/Sokoban_Level_3b "Sokoban Level 3b")
- [Sokoban Level 3c](/wiki/Sokoban_Level_3c "Sokoban Level 3c")
- [Sokoban Level 3d](/wiki/Sokoban_Level_3d "Sokoban Level 3d")
- [Sokoban Level 3e](/wiki/Sokoban_Level_3e "Sokoban Level 3e")
- [Sokoban Level 3f](/wiki/Sokoban_Level_3f "Sokoban Level 3f")
- [Sokoban Level 3g](/wiki/Sokoban_Level_3g "Sokoban Level 3g")
- [Sokoban Level 3h](/wiki/Sokoban_Level_3h "Sokoban Level 3h")
- [Sokoban Level 3i](/wiki/Sokoban_Level_3i "Sokoban Level 3i")
- [Sokoban Level 3j](/wiki/Sokoban_Level_3j "Sokoban Level 3j")
- [Sokoban Level 3k](/wiki/Sokoban_Level_3k "Sokoban Level 3k")

[![This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.](/images/5/5d/Nh343var-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.")

Sokoban Level 1e

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search

This is one of the new possible maps for Sokoban Level 1 in UnNetHack and EvilHack. It has 12 boulders and 11 pits, leaving 1 spare boulder.

Like all Sokoban levels in UnNetHack, this level may be flipped horizontally or vertically. 

----             0 boulder
|??|             ^ pit
|..------------- > starting position/downstairs
|..^^^^^^^^^^^.| < upstairs
|-0--######---+| ? scroll of earth
|.0.0......#...| # iron bars
|...|......#...|
---.|.00.0.#...|
  |.|...|0.#...|
  |.|.00...#...|
  |.|.|.00.#.<.|
  |.|..0.-------
  |.---..|
  |....|>|
  ----...|
     -----

Strategy

The following solution may not be very fast or organized. Improvements welcome. Like all Sokoban levels it can be solved without making any boulders 'stick'.

All boulders are replaced by letters so they can be referred to. Moving the boulders is shortened to r for right, l for left, u for up, d for down. An asterisk is used to denote the last move filled a pit (and thus removed the boulder from the game). So "N ddrr*" means move boulder N two times down and two times to the right into a pit.

First, push a couple of boulders out of the way and solve the first boulder, grabbing the scrolls of earth in the process: 

----             C rrrr
|??|             B rrrr
|..------------- A uudr*
|..^^^^^^^^^^^.|
|-A--######---+|
|.B.C......#...|
|...|......#...|
---.|.DE.F.#...|
  |.|...|G.#...|
  |.|.HI...#...|
  |.|.|.JK.#.<.|
  |.|..L.-------
  |.---..|
  |....|@|
  ----...|
     -----

Now solve the next six boulders: 

----             B llll uuud rr*
|..|             C llll lluu udrr r*
|..------------- D uull lluu udrr rr*
|.@.^^^^^^^^^^.| E uull lllu uudr rrrr*
|-.--######---+| F llll uull luuu drrr rrr*
|.....B.C..#...| G uuul llll lluu udrr rrrr r*
|...|......#...|
---.|.DE.F.#...|
  |.|...|G.#...|
  |.|.HI...#...|
  |.|.|.JK.#.<.|
  |.|..L.-------
  |.---..|
  |....|>|
  ----...|
     -----

The next boulder needs to be moved specifically to prevent getting the final boulders stuck, but from there the solution is straightforward: 

----             J u
|..|             I uuuu llll luuu drrr rrrr r*
|..------------- L uuuu uull lllu uudr rrrr rrrr*
|.......@.^^^^.| J luuu ulll lluu udrr rrrr rrrr*
|-.--######---+| K lluu uuul llll uuud rrrr rrrr rrr*
|..........#...|
|...|......#...|
---.|......#...|
  |.|...|..#...|
  |.|.HI...#...|
  |.|.|.JK.#.<.|
  |.|..L.-------
  |.---..|
  |....|>|
  ----...|
     -----

The level is now complete. Remember to check under the final boulder in case an item happens to be underneath. 

----
|..|
|..-------------
|...........@..|
|-.--######---+|
|..........#...|
|...|......#...|
---.|......#...|
  |.|...|..#...|
  |.|.H....#...|
  |.|.|....#.<.|
  |.|....-------
  |.---..|
  |....|>|
  ----...|
     -----

Next level

UnNetHack's Sokoban branch has only three levels per game, collapsing the 'second' levels into the first floor, so the first level leads straight to the pool of third levels:

  • Sokoban Level 3a
  • Sokoban Level 3b
  • Sokoban Level 3c
  • Sokoban Level 3d
  • Sokoban Level 3e
  • Sokoban Level 3f
  • Sokoban Level 3g
  • Sokoban Level 3h
  • Sokoban Level 3i
  • Sokoban Level 3j
  • Sokoban Level 3k

<!-- Please do not copy this article to Wikia. -->This is one of the new possible maps for [[Sokoban]] Level 1 in [[UnNetHack]] and [[EvilHack]]. It has 12 [[boulder]]s and 11 [[pit]]s, leaving 1 spare boulder.

Like all Sokoban levels in UnNetHack, this level may be flipped horizontally or vertically.

 ----             0 boulder
 |??|             ^ pit
 |..------------- > starting position/downstairs
 |..^^^^^^^^^^^.| < upstairs
 |-0--######---+| ? scroll of earth
 |.0.0......#...| # iron bars
 |...|......#...|
 ---.|.00.0.#...|
   |.|...|0.#...|
   |.|.00...#...|
   |.|.|.00.#.<.|
   |.|..0.-------
   |.---..|
   |....|>|
   ----...|
      -----

==Strategy==
The following solution may not be very fast or organized. Improvements welcome. Like all Sokoban levels it can be solved without making any boulders 'stick'.

All boulders are replaced by letters so they can be referred to. Moving the boulders is shortened to '''r''' for right, '''l''' for left, '''u''' for up, '''d''' for down. An asterisk is used to denote the last move filled a pit (and thus removed the boulder from the game). So "'''N''' ddrr*" means move boulder '''N''' two times down and two times to the right into a pit.

First, push a couple of boulders out of the way and solve the first boulder, grabbing the [[scroll of earth|scrolls of earth]] in the process:

 ----             '''C''' rrrr
 |??|             '''B''' rrrr
 |..------------- '''A''' uudr*
 |..^^^^^^^^^^^.|
 |-A--######---+|
 |.B.C......#...|
 |...|......#...|
 ---.|.DE.F.#...|
   |.|...|G.#...|
   |.|.HI...#...|
   |.|.|.JK.#.<.|
   |.|..L.-------
   |.---..|
   |....|@|
   ----...|
      -----

Now solve the next six boulders:

 ----             '''B''' llll uuud rr*
 |..|             '''C''' llll lluu udrr r*
 |..------------- '''D''' uull lluu udrr rr*
 |.@.^^^^^^^^^^.| '''E''' uull lllu uudr rrrr*
 |-.--######---+| '''F''' llll uull luuu drrr rrr*
 |.....B.C..#...| '''G''' uuul llll lluu udrr rrrr r*
 |...|......#...|
 ---.|.DE.F.#...|
   |.|...|G.#...|
   |.|.HI...#...|
   |.|.|.JK.#.<.|
   |.|..L.-------
   |.---..|
   |....|>|
   ----...|
      -----

The next boulder needs to be moved specifically to prevent getting the final boulders stuck, but from there the solution is straightforward:

 ----             '''J''' u
 |..|             '''I''' uuuu llll luuu drrr rrrr r*
 |..------------- '''L''' uuuu uull lllu uudr rrrr rrrr*
 |.......@.^^^^.| '''J''' luuu ulll lluu udrr rrrr rrrr*
 |-.--######---+| '''K''' lluu uuul llll uuud rrrr rrrr rrr*
 |..........#...|
 |...|......#...|
 ---.|......#...|
   |.|...|..#...|
   |.|.HI...#...|
   |.|.|.JK.#.<.|
   |.|..L.-------
   |.---..|
   |....|>|
   ----...|
      -----

The level is now complete. Remember to check under the final boulder in case an item happens to be underneath.

 ----
 |..|
 |..-------------
 |...........@..|
 |-.--######---+|
 |..........#...|
 |...|......#...|
 ---.|......#...|
   |.|...|..#...|
   |.|.H....#...|
   |.|.|....#.<.|
   |.|....-------
   |.---..|
   |....|>|
   ----...|
      -----

UnNetHack's Sokoban branch has only three levels per game, collapsing the 'second' levels into the first floor, so the first level leads straight to the pool of third levels:
